citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A bottle of meloxicam was identified with an expiration date of 11/2024. This medication was intermingled with other
medications that are routinely used by the facility. Use of expired medications does not constitute the standard of care
and can potentially cause adverse effects to the animals. Medications must be properly disposed of before the expiration
date is reached. The medication was disposed of at the time of inspection.
Corrected at the time of inspection. To remain corrected after March 25, 2025.

The water receptacle in an enclosure housing three puppies was noted to be tipped over and empty. Therefore, potable
water was not made available to these puppies for an indeterminate period of time. The puppies appeared comfortable
and when water was provided, two of the puppies drank briefly from the receptacle. The facility must ensure that potable
water is continuously available to all dogs. Correct by March 26, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A bottle of meloxicam was identified with an expiration date of 11/2024. This medication was intermingled with other 
medications that are routinely used by the facility. Use of expired medications does not constitute the standard of care 
and can potentially cause adverse effects to the animals. Medications must be properly disposed of before the expiration 
date is reached. The medication was disposed of at the time of inspection.  
 
Corrected at the time of inspection. To remain corrected after March 25, 2025. 
3.10(a) 
   
Watering 
The water receptacle in an enclosure housing three puppies was noted to be tipped over and empty. Therefore, potable 
water was not made available to these puppies for an indeterminate period of time. The puppies appeared comfortable 
and when water was provided, two of the puppies drank briefly from the receptacle. The facility must ensure that potable 
water is continuously available to all dogs. Correct by March 26, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
